eu.menzerath.imwd.checker

Class Checker

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.menzerath.imwd.checker.Checker

  • public class Checker
extends Object
    The heart of this application. A Checker manages a single url including and all it's checks and a Logger-instance.

      void startTesting()
      Start testing: Create a timer and schedule it

    • Constructor Detail

      • Checker

        public Checker(int id,
               String url,
               int interval,
               boolean checkContent,
               boolean checkPing,
               boolean logEnabled,
               boolean logValidChecks)
        Constructor: Put the specified values in our own parameters
        Parameters:
        id - Unique ID of this Checker
        url - Which url will get checked
        interval - How often will this url get checked (in seconds)
        checkContent - If this Checker checks content
        checkPing - If this Checker checks ping
        logEnabled - Create a log-file?
        logValidChecks - Log even successful checks?

      • Checker

        public Checker(int id,
               String url,
               int interval,
               boolean checkContent,
               boolean checkPing,
               boolean logEnabled,
               boolean logValidChecks,
               GuiApplication gui)
        Constructor: Put the specified values in our own parameters
        Parameters:
        id - Unique ID of this Checker
        url - Which url will get checked
        interval - How often will this url get checked (in seconds)
        checkContent - If this Checker checks content
        checkPing - If this Checker checks ping
        logEnabled - Create a log-file?
        logValidChecks - Log even successful checks?
        gui - the GUI that needs to be updated

    • Method Detail

      • startTesting

        public void startTesting()
        Start testing: Create a timer and schedule it

      • stopTesting

        public void stopTesting()
        Stop testing: Cancel and purge the timer

      • runTest

        public void runTest()
        The actual testing-method: 1. Try to get content from the site 1.1 Success: Log this and we're done! 1.2: No Success: Try to reach Google to see if there are problems with the internet connection 1.2.1: Success: Ping the url to see, if the webserver is down 1.2.1.1: Success: Webserver is down. Log this and we're done! 1.2.1.2: No Success: Whole server is down. Log this and we're done! 1.2.2: No Success: No connection to the internet! Log this and we're done!

      • testContent

        public boolean testContent()
        Content-Test: Check if there is any content at the url (or more generally a response from the webserver)
        Returns:
        true if there was a response and false if not

      • testPing

        public boolean testPing()
        Ping-Test: Check if a ping is successful
        Returns:
        true if there was a response and false if not
